=== Etiquette ===

* Keep in mind that many software in Ubuntu is '''maintained''' by people in their spare time, brought to you for free.

* If you care about an '''Ubuntu release''' not having bugs, test the <nowiki>[[http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/|daily image]]</nowiki> five months before <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Releases#Future|launch]]</nowiki>. So developers have time to fix it.

* If '''writing more''' doesn't make a tangible difference, write less.

* If you have any '''doubt''', you can <nowiki>[[mailto: Ubuntu Quality Team <ubuntu-quality@lists.ubuntu.com>|ask]]</nowiki> any time. 

=== Not bugs ===

You shouldn't file a bug here if you are:

* <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BIOSUpdate|Using a BIOS or firmware which can be causing the problem]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://askubuntu.com/|Requesting support]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuDevelopment/NewPackages|Requesting new software]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[http://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-devel-discuss|Discussing ideas]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Repositories|Using software outside the official repositories]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[https://translations.launchpad.net/ubuntu|Reporting misspells]]</nowiki>

=== Reporting windowed applications ===

In the Terminal application enter:

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| ubuntu-bug -w
|}

=== Reporting non windowed applications ===

1. Using the <nowiki>[[apt:--synaptic|Synaptic]]</nowiki> application and the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs/FindRightPackage|list of common packages]]</nowiki>, determine which software package is the most likely to be affected.

2. In the '''Terminal''' application enter the following, substituting PACKAGE with your package name:

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| ubuntu-bug PACKAGE
|}

3. Or if you '''haven't been able to determine the package''', just enter:

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| ubuntu-bug
|}

=== Reporting offline systems ===

If the system internet does't work, do the following:

1. On the '''target system''', in the Terminal application enter the following. Substituting PACKAGE with your package name:

* For a crash:
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| apport-cli -p PACKAGE --save bug.crash
|}
* For a any other issue:
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| apport-cli -f -p PACKAGE --save bug.apport
|}

2. '''Copy''' the generated file to the system used for filing the report.

3. On that '''reporting system''', in the Terminal application enter the following. Substituting FILE with your file name:

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| ubuntu-bug -c FILE
|}

=== Reporting unusable systems ===

Only if you system '''doesn't fit''' any of the above methods go to the following site, substituting PACKAGE with your package name:

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| `https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/PACKAGE/+filebug`
|}

Or if you '''haven't been able to determine the package''':

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| `https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+filebug`
|}
